intro: Geunsia serrulata, commonly known as the serrated geunsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
